titleStmt.title: [Promissory note] 1823 Aug. [to] The bank of Tennessee / [signed by] James K. Polk et. al.: a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Memphis Public Library, Memphis, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Memphis Public Library, 3030 Poplar Avenue, Memphis, TN 38111

bibl.title: [Receipt] 1823 Aug. [to] The bank of Tennessee / [signed by] James K. Polk et. al.
bibl.note: This document is a promissory note signed by James K. Polk, William Parr, and George Johnston in August 1823. The document shows that these men have promised to repay $100 to the bank of Tennessee eighty eight days after this note was signed.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p: Eighty eight days after date we promise to pay to the bank of the state of Tennessee or order the sum of One Hundred dollars at the agency of Maury County for Value Received. Witness our hands and seals this day of August 1823
